commit_message:
Add python3 packages to overrides (package-replacement)

This change is to be used if kolla accepts the package-replacement
cli option.  The package-replacement option will parse the package lists
after the add/removes so we don't need to switch the appends/removals to
handle the python3 package names because we would be using the same
package names. The problem with this implementation is how we manage
python2/python3 switched later.

Conflicts-With: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/629679/
Change-Id: I1021ce09f33cf73e036e16b734099539c84aa9c8
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636457/

subject: Add python3 packages for RHEL systems and non-voting fedora job (packages-replacement)
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2019-02-14 23:19:45.000000000', 'files': ['docker/horizon/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/aodh/aodh-base/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/base/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/base/dnf.conf', 'docker/macros.j2', 'docker/base/yum.conf', 'docker/collectd/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/zaqar/zaqar-base/Dockerfile.j2', 'contrib/packages-replacement/rdo-python3.json'], 'message': 'Add python3 packages for RHEL systems and non-voting fedora job (packages-replacement)

RDO is currently working on python3 support for the next version of
CentOS/RHEL based systems.  This package uses the distro_python3 flag
that was added as part of I4028991bad92c0e8e21066cc4173c06ce5eba393 to
use the python3 specific package names.  Additionally this change adds a
package replacement file that can be used to swap out the python2
packages for the python3 equivalents. This is an alternative to managing
the package names in the Dockerfiles from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632156/

Change-Id: I18b475bb9e50e10b6d1142a94ee948a41ab0ff8b
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
'}]
commit_message:
Add python3 packages for RHEL systems and non-voting fedora job (packages-replacement)

RDO is currently working on python3 support for the next version of
CentOS/RHEL based systems.  This package uses the distro_python3 flag
that was added as part of I4028991bad92c0e8e21066cc4173c06ce5eba393 to
use the python3 specific package names.  Additionally this change adds a
package replacement file that can be used to swap out the python2
packages for the python3 equivalents. This is an alternative to managing
the package names in the Dockerfiles from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632156/

Change-Id: I18b475bb9e50e10b6d1142a94ee948a41ab0ff8b
Related-Blueprint: python3-support

subject: Fix validation of required services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-19 17:28:13.000000000', 'files': ['rally_openstack/validators.py', 'tests/unit/test_validators.py'], 'message': 'Fix validation of required services

Cinder team decided to remove Cinder V1 (which is ok since they already
have V3 API) but our logic of required_service validator was not ready
for such step.

This patch includes the next changes of the validaotr:

* Check for nova-network before initializing clients. This is a simple
  check which does not require initialized clients. Since the keystone
  token is fetched while initializing clients, it can be time wasting.
  Also, it is time to fail on this check.

* In case of NotFound error while direct search by service type, use the
  default one
  NOTE: actually, the default service type should be the same as  what
        we have in consts file...

Change-Id: I2018a9b9323cce05ee226fefdc3fe50c356aed9a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix validation of required services

Cinder team decided to remove Cinder V1 (which is ok since they already
have V3 API) but our logic of required_service validator was not ready
for such step.

This patch includes the next changes of the validaotr:

* Check for nova-network before initializing clients. This is a simple
  check which does not require initialized clients. Since the keystone
  token is fetched while initializing clients, it can be time wasting.
  Also, it is time to fail on this check.

* In case of NotFound error while direct search by service type, use the
  default one
  NOTE: actually, the default service type should be the same as  what
        we have in consts file...

Change-Id: I2018a9b9323cce05ee226fefdc3fe50c356aed9a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-02-08 15:52:08.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_aoe.py'], 'message': 'Make sure looping calls are properly mocked

The test test_connect_volume_device_not_valid in
FibreChannelConnectorTestCase was taking over 6 seconds to complete
since the FixedIntervalLoopingCall in the method under test was not
being mocked out, making the test hang until the timeout was reached.

This fixes this and any other connector test case by moving the mocking
with a test fake into the base connector test class setUp call.

Change-Id: I6b174d94b5518d6267c1fa75528a90d95a312419
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure looping calls are properly mocked

The test test_connect_volume_device_not_valid in
FibreChannelConnectorTestCase was taking over 6 seconds to complete
since the FixedIntervalLoopingCall in the method under test was not
being mocked out, making the test hang until the timeout was reached.

This fixes this and any other connector test case by moving the mocking
with a test fake into the base connector test class setUp call.

Change-Id: I6b174d94b5518d6267c1fa75528a90d95a312419
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Remove neutron_lib.db from db profiling projects
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-02-20 10:09:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/tests/unit/db/test_api.py', 'neutron_lib/db/api.py', 'releasenotes/notes/remove-neutron-lib-from-db-profiling-38436898d8e45b37.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove neutron_lib.db from db profiling projects

All db calls which are tracked by osprofiler are comming from
neutron and there is no need to enable sqlalchemy profiling for
both of them as this results in duplicated sql calls in osprofiler
reports.

Change-Id: I5b909b4181cd0fec432b78363c8a84ca40a5cf3e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove neutron_lib.db from db profiling projects

All db calls which are tracked by osprofiler are comming from
neutron and there is no need to enable sqlalchemy profiling for
both of them as this results in duplicated sql calls in osprofiler
reports.

Change-Id: I5b909b4181cd0fec432b78363c8a84ca40a5cf3e
